Fear not that I shall be the instrument of
uture mischief. My work is nearly complete. Neither
ours nor any mans death is needed to consum-
mate the series of my being, & accomplish that
which must be done; but it requires my own.
Do not fear that I shall be slow to perform
this sacrifize. I shall quit your vessel on the
ice-raft which brought me hither; & shall
seek with rapid steps, the most northern ex-
-tremity of the globe. I shall collect my funeral
pile, & consume to ashes this miserable frame,
that its remains may afford no light to any
curious & unhallowed ^wretch who would create such
another as I have been. I shall die. I shall
